item.title: Notes on Game Theory
item.description: Extensive Game, Perfect Information Strategy Subgame Chance Moves Bargaining textbook 1: (OR) A Course in Game Theory textbook 2: (BM) Fun and games Reference: Carlos Hurtado’s lecture notes Extensive Game, Perfect Information OR 6.1 Reference Set of players: \(N\) Set of histories: \(H\) History (sequence): \(h = (a^k)_{k=1}^K\) Initial history: \(\emptyset\in H\) \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\), \(K>L\implies (a^k)_{k=1}^L\in H\) \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) for all \(K\in\mathbb{N} \implies (a^k)_{k=1}^{\infty}\in H\) Set of terminal histories: \(Z\) Terminal history: \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) is terminal if exists no \((a^k)_{k=1}^{K+1}\in H\) Set of (possible) actions: \(A(h): \{ a \ | \ (h,a)\in H\}\) Action: \(a\in h\) for some \(k\in K\) History of length \(k+1\): \((h,a)\) Player function: \(P: (H\backslash Z)\to N\) Player to move after history \(h\): \(P(h)\) Initial player: \(P(\emptyset)\) with \(a^0\in A(\emptyset)\) Second player: \(P(a^0)\) with \(a^1\in A(a^0)\) Preference relation: \(\succsim_i\) defined on \(Z\) Extensive Game with Perfect Information: \[Γ = \langle N,H,P,(\succsim_i)\rangle\text{ or }\langle N,H,P\rangle\] Finite game: \(|H|<\infty\) Finite horizon: \(K <\infty\) for all \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) Rank of game: \(\max K\) for all \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) Length of game: \(l(Γ)\) is the length of longest history in \(Γ\) Exercise (slides P13)
